title: (x) Condensed Art Deco caps - Bodega Sans Oldstyle (customized) {Yves}
content:
Hi,   
I need help ID'ing these letterforms. I've never seen this font before but they are used in a logotype.   
   
So there is the possibility that they are custom.   
   
Thanks in advance for your help!   
Adam   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33804.jpg)
author: typehack

comments.content:
I also thought it had that Bodega Sans flava, mixed with [Plaza](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124647/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/plaza-2/)-style embellishments.   
   
But at this moment I have no idea what the real font is, if it is indeed a font.

I agree with Yves. Maybe [this showing at Phils Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124647/http:/www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=FB00001702P2) isolates the Oldstyle better? I think the add-on swash is just that, and it looks too light for the font strokes (IMO). A little outline tweaking would account for most other variations from the original font, I think.

Thank you all very much! It was customized, whether it was done well or not, is another discussion.   
   
Have a great week.
